com.algos.droidactivator
Class DroidActivator

java.lang.Object
  com.algos.droidactivator.DroidActivator

public class DroidActivator
extends java.lang.Object

Main DroidActivator's class.

This is istantiated by calling the newInstance() method.

DroidActivator uses the Singleton pattern, so after instantiation you don't have to keep track of an instance and can make only static calls. Usage example:

DroidActivator.newInstance(this, "http://151.10.128.32:8080",new Runnable() {

public void run() {startMyApp();}

});

Method Detail

doActivationCycle

public static void doActivationCycle(Context context)
Performs the Activation Cycle (update and check). When completed, your Runnable is run.

Parameters:
context - the current context

isActivated

public static boolean isActivated()
Checks if the app is currently activated.

Uses a combination of cached data and temporary activation.

If Temporary Activation is on, always returns true. If off, lloks in cached data.

Returns:
whether the app is activated

public static void setActivated(boolean activated)
Sets the activation flag in cached data.

Parameters:
activated - the activation flag

setDialogCustomView

public static void setDialogCustomView(View view)
Sets a view to be displayed in the message area of the dialog instead of the default message view.

If a custom view is specified, the custom view takes precedence over the custom text.

Parameters:
view - the custom view

setDialogCustomText

public static void setDialogCustomText(java.lang.String text)
Sets a text to display in the message view instead of the standard message.

If a custom view is specified, the custom view takes precedence over the custom text.

Parameters:
text - the custom text

newInstance

public static void newInstance(Context ctx,
                               java.lang.String address,
                               java.lang.Runnable runnable)
Create the Singleton instance of this class.

Parameters:
ctx - the context
address - the backend address
runnable - the runnable to run to start your app when an Activation Cycle is completed.

Valid backend addresses are in the form "http://123.123.123.123:8080" or "http://mydomain.com:8081".

The default backend port is 8080.
